<div align="center">

<img src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="Project Banner">

<h1>Student Grade Management System</h1>

<p>
A full-stack web application that allows teachers to easily manage student grades by uploading Excel or CSV files. The system provides a simple interface for viewing, adding, editing, and deleting student records, along with a history of all file uploads.
</p>

</div>

🚀 Features
Excel/CSV Upload: Add student data in bulk by uploading .xlsx or .csv files.

Automated Grade Calculation: Automatically calculates and displays the percentage for each student.

Full CRUD Functionality:

Create: Add new students via file upload.

Read: View all student records in a clear, organized table.

Update: Edit a student's name and marks using a simple pop-up form.

Delete: Remove student records from the database.

Upload History: Tracks every file upload, showing the file name, status (Success/Failed), and the number of records processed.

🛠️ Tech Stack

</div>

📋 Getting Started
Follow these steps to get the project running on your local machine.

Prerequisites
Node.js (v20.x or higher)

npm (Node Package Manager)

A MongoDB Atlas account for the database.

Installation
<table>
<tr>
<td valign="top">
<h3>1. Clone the Repository</h3>
<p>Open your terminal and clone the project.</p>
<pre><code>git clone &lt;your-repository-url&gt;
cd student-grade-system</code></pre>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<h3>2. Set up the Backend</h3>
<p>Navigate to the server, install dependencies, and set up your environment variables.</p>
<pre><code>cd server
npm install</code></pre>
<p>Create a <b>.env</b> file and add your MongoDB URI:</p>
<pre><code>MONGO_URI=your_mongodb_connection_string</code></pre>
<p>Start the server:</p>
<pre><code>npm start</code></pre>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<h3>3. Set up the Frontend</h3>
<p>In a <b>new terminal</b>, navigate to the client and install dependencies.</p>
<pre><code>cd client
npm install
npm run dev</code></pre>
<p>The application will open at <code>http://localhost:5173</code>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<details>
<summary><strong>📄 Required File Format</strong></summary>
<br>
For a successful upload, your spreadsheet file must have these exact column headers:
<ul>
<li><code>Student_ID</code></li>
<li><code>Student_Name</code></li>
<li><code>Total_Marks</code></li>
<li><code>Marks_Obtained</code></li>
</ul>
</details>
